message.content:
cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.IT, cs.NA, cs.CC

Reasoning: The paper deals with combinatorics on words, which is a subfield of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). It also involves the study of patterns and their avoidance, which is related to formal languages (cs.FL) and information theory (cs.IT). The use of non-erasing morphisms suggests a connection to numeration systems and automatic sequences, which fall under the category of numerical analysis (cs.NA). Finally, the paper may also be relevant to the study of algorithms and complexity theory, as the problem of pattern avoidance can be formulated as a decision problem (cs.CC).
